result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle T Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Pursue fulltime employment or schooling fulltime or combination as deemed appropriate by the agent.
Comply with any further assessments requested by the agent and follow any treatment recommendations.
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyle T Wagner in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Defendant Kyle T Wagner in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:15 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  Requests a PSI. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Informs the court the defendant is willing to waive his PSI and agree to the caps as stated by the prosecutor.
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant agrees, he will waive the PSI. 
Atty Barkley indicates the defendant is currently a prison inmate. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 1 & 2 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 3 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Prison for 3 1/2 years, 319 days credit
18 months Initial Confinement followed by 24 months Extended Supervision, concurrent to the sentence he is currently serving: 

Count 2 - 
Prison for 5 years, 319 days credit
30 months Initial Confinement followed by 30 months Extended Supervision, concurrent to Count 1 and any other sentence he is currently serving

Conditions: 
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Pursue fulltime employment or schooling fulltime or combination as deemed appropriate by the agent.
Comply with any further assessments requested by the agent and follow any treatment recommendations. 
Pay costs on each count including the DNA surcharge. 

Not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse programs.
Plea hearing on February 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jerod Barkley in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:03 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Defendant does not appear.

Atty Barkley addresses the Court, client is still in the prison system. A writ was prepared, contacted the jail this morning and Defendant is not here. Jail indicated that they did not receive a copy of the writ.

State will prepare the writ for the next date.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Jury trial - 12 person on August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 2, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kyle T Wagner in court with attorney Jerod A Barkley. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:33 pm Court calls case.
ADA Cousins states appearances.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Atty Barkley.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.

BTC:
Court orders Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Jerod Albert Barkley in court.  Defendant Kyle T Wagner appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Veronica Fay Isherwood appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT: 
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Barkley

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription from the doctor. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *On all court dates.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Meth, Paraphernalia.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Atty Cousins recommends a $1,500 cash bond with conditions. 
Court advises defendant of right to make a statement. 
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant is on a probation hold at this time. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  4/7/14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
